alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; New Hanover (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 19 at 10:16AM EDT until May 19 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY FOR NORTHEASTERN BRUNSWICK AND NORTHWESTERN NEW HANOVER COUNTIES... At 1016 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 5 and 10 inches of rain have fallen with some unofficial reports greater than 10 inches. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wilmington, Leland, Bishop, Hightsville, Phoenix, Town Creek, Winnabow, Silver Lake, Wrightsboro, Wilmington International Airport, University Of North Carolina At Wilmington, Kings Grant, Murrayville, Ogden, Belville, Navassa and New Hanover Regional Medical Center. Received reports of multiple roads flooded and closed with some stranded vehicles in the Leland area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
